credentials: PHD 2000 Univ of Michigan at Ann Arbor
name: Kael Hanson

ratings.comment: I did not learn a thing when this man was teaching. He is very disorganized and obviously does not do much planning before lecture begins.

I feel like Hanson is just frazzled every time we have lecture. Like he doesn't seem like an evil person but like I genuinely have never understood a single word that came out of his mouth during lecture. Like I was extra confused on every topic he specifically taught. Good luck if Prof. Hanson is your only option as a physics professor.

THIS IS THE WORST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN! EXAMS ARE TERRIBLE AND THE LECTURES DO NOT REFLECT WHAT WE NEED TO KNOW FOR THE EXAM! I HAVE NEVER BEEN MORE STRESSED ABOUT AN ENTRY LEVEL COURSE! THIS A TERRIBLE CLASS!

Physics104 is one of the worst classes I've ever taken. Practice problems are so much easier than any of the questions on the exams. I leave more confused from Kael's lectures than when I got there. He goes off on many tangents and often gets problems wrong. Should probably be teaching to more advanced physics students who already know the basics.

Kael is too much of an expert in his field that he simply cannot break it down for someone encountering it for the first time. He goes off on random tangents during class, when we really just want to know the basics of physics. He also tends to solve problems and get them wrong. Although I'm sure he's a very nice man, he's not a great professor.
His lectures are VERY boring and he has scattered thinking
So bad at lecturing I would rather have a child teach it to me. He seems to get so confused by what he is saying that he stops multiples times to restart explanations.

i have never had a professor more disorganized & all over the place. physics is hard enough i come out of lecture even more confused than i did coming into it. he contradicts himself all the time and doesn't explain things fully. i have never been more confused in a class
he just seems so frazzled and stressed all the time it makes ME stressed
While Prof. Hanson is very knowledgable about physics, he struggles to put his thoughts into words. Lectures are very confusing and disorganized.
he is a terrible public speaker and cannot organize his thoughts while teaching. lecture becomes unbearable and nothing makes sense.

Had Kael for 103/104 - very disorganized in lecture & often struggles w/ teaching students concepts (almost as if he himself doesn't understand them). Lectures are hard to follow & I often left feeling more confused than when I got there. Classroom is also flipped learning & prelecture content is horribly subpar, & lecture does not help at all.

Prof is very accessible outside of class, responds to emails quickly, and makes absolutely sure you leave office hours with a better understanding of the material. The teaching style is conversational and he tries to help you approach the same problem in different ways. Best physics prof I've had so far.
Very disorganized. Could benefit from practicing what he will teach before he comes to lecture.

He's fantastic, I learned so much in this class. He's really friendly and helpful outside of class, responds to emails right away, and helpfully answers questions in class too. While I did find it necessary to ask lots of questions in class to get a solid explanation, in the end he always got everything across well. His exams were fair too.

The professor is disorganized in lecture and he demonstrates vs teaches sometimes. But he is personable and extremely accessible outside of class. Sometimes he is not very clear on what he is trying to teach because he teaches straight out of examples rather than on theory. His lectures on digital logic are very cool and interesting.
